title: LLM Fine-Tuning & RAG System
description: Architected end-to-end QA system using BERT/RoBERTa. Implemented LoRA/QLoRA for 4x memory reduction and engineered semantic retrieval pipelines achieving 85%+ accuracy[cite: 27, 28, 29].
motivation: To overcome the hallucination and memory limitations of base LLMs when handling domain-specific data without the prohibitive cost of full fine-tuning.
challenges: Reducing the massive memory footprint of transformer models to run on limited hardware while maintaining inference speed.
learnings: Mastered Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) techniques like LoRA/QLoRA to achieve 4x memory reduction [cite: 28] and optimized dense vector retrieval for semantic search.

title: Multi-Model Time Series Forecasting
description: Built production-grade demand forecasting system processing 100K+ daily transactions. [cite_start]Developed hybrid model (GRU/LSTM + LightGBM/XGBoost) improving baseline accuracy by 35%[cite: 32, 33, 34].
motivation: To solve the inventory optimization problem for F&B data, which requires handling high volatility and seasonality across multiple stores[cite: 32].
challenges: Capturing complex temporal patterns like holidays and seasonality in noisy transaction data.
learnings: Learned to engineer 50+ temporal features (Fourier transforms, lag variables) [cite: 34] and how to ensemble Deep Learning with Gradient Boosting for robust predictions.

title: Reinforcement Learning Visual Agent
description: Developed deep RL agent using policy gradients for spatial tasks. [cite_start]Designed reward shaping curriculum achieving 3.5x improvement over heuristics[cite: 37, 38].
motivation: To explore how agents can learn complex spatial reasoning and visual planning without explicit rule-based instructions[cite: 37].
challenges: The 'sparse reward' problem where the agent struggles to learn effectively when positive feedback is rare.
learnings: Implemented curriculum learning and reward shaping to guide the agent [cite: 38] [cite_start]and used MLflow to rigorously track 50+ experiments[cite: 39].

title: High-Concurrency Ticket System
description: Built 3-tier distributed system with custom TCP protocol, achieving 40% higher throughput than Java RMI. [cite_start]Implemented 2PC for ACID compliance[cite: 60, 61].
motivation: To overcome the performance bottlenecks of standard Java RMI in high-throughput environments.
challenges: Ensuring data consistency (ACID) across distributed nodes without killing performance.
learnings: Deepened understanding of low-level networking by designing a custom TCP protocol [cite: 60] [cite_start]and implementing Two-Phase Commit (2PC) for transaction safety[cite: 61].

title: Distributed Consensus (Paxos)
description: Implemented Paxos consensus algorithm to maintain data consistency across replicas during network failures[cite: 62].
motivation: To deeply understand how distributed systems maintain consistency in the presence of partition faults and crashes.
challenges: Handling asynchronous messaging and ensuring correctness during simulated network failures and partitions.
learnings: Gained intuition for distributed consensus and multi-threaded coordination using BlockingQueue and ConcurrentHashMap[cite: 63].

title: ZooKeeper Distributed Platform
description: Engineered distributed platform with manager-worker architecture. [cite_start]Implemented dynamic worker registration and load balancing using ZooKeeper[cite: 64].
motivation: To build a resilient system capable of dynamic scaling and fault tolerance without manual intervention.
challenges: Coordinating tasks between managers and workers in real-time as nodes join and leave the cluster.
learnings: Mastered event-driven coordination using ZooKeeper watches [cite: 64] to implement dynamic load balancing.

title: Custom Operating System in C
description: Developed OS from scratch implementing process scheduling, memory paging, and heap allocation. [cite_start]Integrated system calls for user/kernel space communication[cite: 88, 89].
motivation: To demystify how software interacts with hardware by building the core components of an OS from the ground up.
challenges: Managing raw memory pointers and preventing leaks/crashes when implementing paging and heap allocation[cite: 90].
learnings: Achieved proficiency in C and low-level system design, specifically process scheduling algorithms and kernel-level resource management[cite: 89].

title: Healthcare Database System
description: Designed E/R model and relational schema for healthcare data. [cite_start]Built Java backend with raw SQL queries enforcing ACID transactions[cite: 92, 93, 94].
motivation: To design a data system that guarantees integrity and reliability for critical healthcare records.
challenges: Ensuring data consistency and ACID compliance when handling concurrent CRUD operations[cite: 94].
learnings: Learned to translate complex real-world requirements into normalized Relational Schemas [cite: 92] and optimize raw SQL queries.

title: McGill SOCS Website Backend
description: Engineered scalable backend using PHP/MySQL with MVC architecture. [cite_start]Developed RESTful APIs with Singleton pattern DB connections[cite: 97, 98].
motivation: To modernize a legacy web backend into a modular, maintainable MVC architecture.
challenges: Reducing server load and ensuring efficient database connections for a student portal.
learnings: Applied design patterns (Singleton, MVC) [cite: 97, 98] [cite_start]to write clean, maintainable code and implemented caching for performance[cite: 100].

title: Semantic Analysis of Tweets
description: Applied NLP techniques (TF-IDF, LSA/SVD) to preprocess and model tweet sentiment. [cite_start]Trained classification models improving interpretability[cite: 102, 104].
motivation: To extract meaningful sentiment trends from unstructured, noisy social media text.
challenges: Handling the high dimensionality and noise inherent in short-text tweet data.
learnings: Learned to use Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA) via SVD to uncover hidden topics [cite: 104] and improve model interpretability.
